name: An "M" Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who did Zirichi kill according to 2 Chronicles 28:7 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Maaseiah.

	Maaseiah was the king's son. Maaseiah's name means "the word of the Lord".

questions.text: In Acts 19:22 (KJV) where did Paul send Timotheus and Erastus?
questions.explanation:
Macedonia.

	The verse states that Paul stayed in Asia. Macedonia is a country found in the Balkans.

questions.text: When the children of Israel left Haradah, where was the next place they went?
questions.explanation:
Makheloth.

	This can be found in Numbers 33:25 (KJV). The next verse says from Makheloth they went to Tahath. Mekheloth means "assemblies".

questions.text: Malachi has a book of the Bible with his name. However his name is only mentioned once in the King James Version. Where is it?
questions.explanation:
Malachi 1:1.

	Malachi is the last book of the Old Testament. Malachi's name means "messenger". He is one of the minor prophets.

questions.text: Whose ear did Peter cut off, according to John 18:10 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Malchus.

	Malchus was the high priest's servant. Peter was acting out in anger because they just arrested Jesus. The book of Luke 22:51 is the only one of the four Gospels that says Jesus healed his ear.

questions.text: In Song of Solomon 5:15 (KJV), how does the woman describe the man's legs: pillars of what?
questions.explanation:
marble.

	She says they are "set up on sockets of gold". Marble is a metamorphic rock. It is made up mostly of calcite and dolomite.

questions.text: According to Proverbs 20:3 (KJV), what will every fool be doing?
questions.explanation:
meddling.

	The verse also says, "It is an honor for a man to cease from strife." When you meddle in other peoples' lives it ends up causing nothing but trouble.

questions.text: What does Matthew 5:5 (KJV) say the meek shall inherit?
questions.explanation:
the Earth.

	Being meek does not mean letting people walk over you. Meek means being gentle in nature, not one to fight.

questions.text: What did the blind man ask Jesus to have on him, in Luke's Gospel?
questions.explanation:
mercy.

	This verse is found in Luke 18:38 (KJV). Jesus restored the man's sight because of his faith.

questions.text: What does Amos 4:9 (KJV) say God has smitten the people with, that starts with M?
questions.explanation:
mildew.

	It also says he had smitten them with blasting. He said despite this causing the crops to fail they still didn't return to Him.
